intro: Scabiosa libyca, commonly known as the Libyan scabious, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Scabiosa libyca is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
